result.execSummary:
The defendant Trace Jon McKay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 13CF734 if revoked

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: 13CF734 if revoked

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Defendant must attend 7 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Defendant is not to have a relationship with any women for the first year after he is released.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.

12-28-2015 sentencing hearing.

Defendant Trace Jon McKay in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Trace Jon McKay in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Parties are ready to proceed.
PSI has been filed.  No additions or corrections by either party.  Mr. McKay speaks on his own behalf.
State presents it's sentencing argument and recommends cons. prison.  Defense presents it's sentencing argument.   

13CF734
Escape - 6 yrs wps:  3/3   I&S 3 yrs probation

Possession of cocaine 2nd -   9 mo RCJ cons. to escape charge  1 yr conc. prob

15CF811
BJ - 6 yrs wps: 3/3 cons. to 13CF734 I&S 3 yrs probation



Conditions:
Defendant is to serve 365 days with 266 days CFTS.  He must successfully complete the in jail BHS program  and may be released upon completion of the in patient portion of that program. He must successfully complete the aftercare while on probation. Must go to a self help program everyday.  Urged to obtain a sponsor and go through the 12 step program.  Must turn in sheets for 7 meetings per week.  If he misses one he can make it up but must complete 7 per week.
no drugs or alco  Random UAs
No relationship with any women for the first year after he is released.
find and maintain full time employment 
pay court costs, assessments and supervision fees.
Must provide a DNA sample and pay for the testing if he has not already done so.

FAW warning
VOTE
Sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 10:00 am
